"FAQPage", "mainEntity": [{"@type": "Question", "name": "What is Usability Testing?", "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "Usability testing evaluates how easily users interact with a product, website, or app. Can they navigate it easily? Can they complete their tasks? It\u2019s an important part of quality assurance (QA) engineering and the broader software development life cycle (SDLC)."}}, {"@type": "Question", "name": "When Does Usability Testing Happen?", "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "During Development Testing early means catching usability issues before they become expensive problems. It helps refine features, validate ideas, and ensures the product is intuitive \u2014 not just functional. Before Launch This is the last line of defense before your product goes live. A final usability test helps spot any lingering issues that could annoy users and ensures everything is polished for the real world. After Major Updates Every big change\u2014new features, redesigned workflows, or user interface (UI) tweaks\u2014should get tested to make sure it actually improves the experience instead of making things worse. At the Start of a Redesign A fresh look is great, but if it doesn\u2019t align with what users want and need, it\u2019s pointless. Testing before and during a redesign ensures your changes are purposeful and user-focused."}}, {"@type": "Question", "name": "How to Learn Usability Testing?", "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "First, get familiar with UX principles and usability testing. All you have to do is sign up for Skillcrush\u2019s Break Into Tech program and enroll in the UI/UX design track where you\u2019ll learn everything from user research and data collection to building prototypes and wireframes. Next, try out usability testing tools like UserTesting.com or HotJar to record real user interactions and spot problem areas. But don\u2019t just rely on tools\u2014conduct usability testing yourself. Ask your friends or family to complete a task on an app or website while you watch them. The more you practice, the better you\u2019ll get at spotting usability issues and making data-driven recommendations that companies are willing to pay top dollar for."}}, {"@type": "Question", "name": "What's the difference between user testing and usability testing?", "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "Mixing up usability testing and user testing is easy, but they\u2019re not the same thing. Usability testing is focused on the product\u2014how easy it is to use, how efficiently users can complete specific tasks, and where they struggle. User testing is about understanding the people themselves\u2014user needs, behaviors, and what influences their decisions."}}]}]

She helps people empower themselves to find jobs that fit their lives by providing practical information, resources, and insights into flexible jobs and the future of work. With a Masters degree in human resources and a background in career advising, Brie has been working with job seekers and employers since 2004, and she offers career, hiring, and work-life balance advice through the FlexJobs Blog and media outlets like Fast Company, Forbes, The Today Show Online, and NBC News. Python uses a simple syntax that emphasizes readability, making it a great language for beginners. Here's a basic example: # This is a comment x = 5  # assign the value 5 to the variable x y = 10  # assign the value 10 to the variable y z = x + y  # add x and y and assign the result to z print(z)  # print the value of z This code will output 15, the sum of 5 and 10."}}]}]

"FAQPage", "mainEntity": [{"@type": "Question", "name": "What exactly is machine learning?", "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "Machine learning is a subset of AI that enables machines (aka computers) to imitate intelligent human behavior by using data and algorithms to learn from patterns and relationships, thereby making predictions and decisions."}}, {"@type": "Question", "name": "What are the 4 basics of machine learning?", "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "The four basics of machine learning include: 1. Algorithms: Rules that computers follow to solve problems. 2. Data: Massive sets of information that algorithms learn from. 3. Patterns: Recognizable trends in the data. 4. Predictions: The outcome or decision made based on learned patterns."}}, {"@type": "Question", "name": "What is the difference between AI and ML?", "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "AI (Artificial Intelligence) is a broader concept that encompasses machines performing tasks in a way that mimics human intelligence. ML (Machine Learning) is a subset of AI focused specifically on giving machines the ability to learn and improve from experience without being explicitly programmed for each task."}}, {"@type": "Question", "name": "What are the 4 types of machine learning?", "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "The four types of machine learning algorithms are: 1. Supervised Learning: Uses labeled data to train algorithms on a specific output. 2. Semi-Supervised Learning: Combines both labeled and unlabeled data for training, useful for saving resources. 3. Unsupervised Learning: Deals with unlabeled data, letting the algorithm find structure within. 4. Reinforcement Learning: Focuses on learning based on actions and feedback rather than data."}}, {"@type": "Question", "name": "What is machine learning in simple terms?", "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "Machine learning is the process by which humans teach computers to use data to learn and make decisions similar to the way humans do, but without being directly programmed for each decision or action."}}, {"@type": "Question", "name": "What is machine learning very short answer?", "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "Machine learning is a human-made technology that allows machines to learn from data and make decisions or predictions based on that learning."}}]}]

data sets. Think of it as the difference between your local library and the entire internet."}}, {"@type": "Question", "name": "What are the 3 types of Big Data?", "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "There are three types of data: structured, unstructured, and semi-structured. Structured datavincludes numbers and text that fit neatly into rows and columns, like sales records or customer information. Unstructured data includes videos, tweets, emails, or photos \u2014 information that doesn\u2019t fit neatly into boxes because of all the different channels and forms. Semi-structured data sits somewhere in between, like an email with a subject line, body text, and attachments. It has some structure but not enough to be fully categorized and cataloged."}}, {"@type": "Question", "name": "What are the 5 characteristics of Big Data?", "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "The five characteristics of big data are: volume, velocity, variety, veracity, and value."}}]}]

Having a basic understanding of things like variables, loops, and data structure will definitely help, but that understanding shouldn\u2019t stop you from getting started. You can learn the basics of R in just a few hours. Some introductory courses, like Codecademy\u2019s 14-hour introductory course, are a great way to try out R without a huge time commitment."}}]}]

Its ability to integrate multiple LLMs and data sources adds to its robustness."}}, {"@type": "Question", "name": "What is LangChain OpenAI?", "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "LangChain OpenAI refers to integrating OpenAI's large language models, like GPT-3 and GPT-4, within the LangChain framework. This allows developers to leverage OpenAI's text completion and chat capabilities, enabling sophisticated NLP applications."}}]}]

These are the menus, pages, and forms you see on a screen through your web browser."}}, {"@type": "Question", "name": "Who Should Be a Front End Developer?", "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "Front end web development is THE place to start if you\u2019re new to tech. So\u2026pretty much everybody! You can learn the most basic skills needed for front end development in a matter of months, and then leverage those skills into paid work."}}, {"@type": "Question", "name": "What Are Front End Web Developer Skills?", "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "These languages and libraries, along with various best QA, project tracking, and bug testing practices, are the foundation of front end web development: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery, and React JavaScript."}}, {"@type": "Question", "name": "What is a Back End Web Developer?", "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "Back end web developers are responsible for building and maintaining the \u201cunder the hood\u201d infrastructure that allows websites and mobile apps to function, including but not limited to: databases, server scripts, and APIs."}}, {"@type": "Question", "name": "Who Should Be a Back End Developer?", "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "In most cases it\u2019s best to pursue back end development if you\u2019ve already been around the tech block a few times. Due to being versed in both sides of the development process, full stack developers can contribute anywhere as needed on a development team."}}, {"@type": "Question", "name": "Who Should Be a Full Stack Developer?", "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "If you\u2019re interested in working on ALL parts of a website \u2014 from the front end functionality to the depths of the database and server-side processes \u2014 then full stack development is a great career to pursue."}}]}]
